Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I learned about various topics at the crossroads of social psychology and perception, in addition to learning about the experimental paradigms used to explore these topics.

This class helped me develop a specific set of analytical skills relevant to determining the quality of experimental design in the field of Cognitive Science. These skills will be invaluable when I am trying to generate a study of my own or evaluate a study conducted by my peers.

The readings for this course are all fascinating, and the discussions were very good. There were times when we got caught up in tangential matters, but that was often interesting and not a problem. One improvement could be more feedback on reading responses.
Yes, I will highly recommend this course.
I would definitely recommend this course to people interested in how low-level details in our environment and perceptual input can have significant effects on higher level cognition.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student, especially a student interested in Cognitive Science. Brian Scholl is unparalleled among Yale's faculty in terms of the depth of his knowledge about the mind as well as his superior talent for analysis.
